searchDocs.title: 2.0.0 Release Update
searchDocs.content: Info: Changed link to New vault template, you can buy it from the site or find it free in the official Obsidian community! New features: Added Calendar and Timeline supports! Thanks 702573N!Added "Engage current file" commandAdded "Clock emoji" command Changes: Improved auto-fail using rrule, all types of recurrences managed by the task plugin now work with auto fail! (try every monday, tuesday for example)Improved auto delay, now 2 commands are available, one to generate a date, and one to delay "All dates" in the current file. Bug fixes: Fixed unexpected behavior on "Done" and "Due done" pages.

searchDocs.title: 2.0.1 Release Update
searchDocs.content: Bug fixes: Fixed auto-fail not working in certain timezones.Added fail-safe to auto-fail to prevent infinite loop.

searchDocs.title: 2.0.2 Release Update
searchDocs.content: Info: Changed links to new vault template, find it in the official obsidian community or in the Personal OS discord New features: Added function support for Xp and progress calculation.Added Simple profile view (to be improved on)Added Command to launch profile view

searchDocs.title: 1.0.0 Initial Release
searchDocs.content: Info: The first release of Personal OS! New features: Start Work CommandStart Process CommandRandom SnoozeAuto Fail Tasks

searchDocs.title: 1.1.0 Release Update
searchDocs.content: Info: Link added in the setting to a New vault template ! filled with dashboards, plugins and tutorials on how to use the Personal OS method!Link added in the setting to a discord community if you need any help or want to talk about the Personal OS Vault!Link added in the setting to the plugin Github if you notice any bug or have a feature request! New features: Added Progress Bar in plugin, preventing the need to use external services.Added an Engage current file to apply Engage logic to all files "Handled" by the current fileAdded a "Random date" feature to generate a random date between the usual snooze categories.Added a Feedback XP notice when finishing tasks, this can be disabled in the plugin config.Added a changelog modal when updating the plugin , this can be disable in the plugin config. Changes: Changed command names for Start Work and Start Process : Engage + ProcessImproved auto-change workspace by saving previous workspaceImproved auto-change workspace by selecting a "Mobile" version of the workspace on mobile. Bug fixes: Fix Engage feature to work properly with all tasks prioritiesFix Random Snooze for due datesFix auto fail current file to include current day. No change on failing all work in progress files.Fix done file showing when there were still files later

searchDocs.title: Plugin Commands
searchDocs.content: Plugin Commands Engage Process Set focus Reload graph Profile View Delay file dates Insert time emoji Move file to folder Engage Current File Toggle actions hider Generate delayed date Auto fail current file Auto fail work in progress files

searchDocs.title: Plugin Documentation
searchDocs.content: Plugin Documentation

searchDocs.title: Prequisites‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The Personal OS plugin leverages functionality from these community plugins:  BRAT: Used in order to run DatacoreDatacore: Used for data queries and dashboardsDataview: Used for data queries and dashboardsTasks: Used for task management

searchDocs.title: Easy Installation‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Enable community plugins in your Obsidian vaultInstall the Personal OS plugin through the community plugin browser in your vault settingsEnable the Personal OS plugin

searchDocs.title: Manual Installation‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Go to the Releases page in the obsidian-personal-os GitHub repositoryDownload the main.js, manifest.json, and styles.css files in the latest releaseCreate a folder called personal-os in the plugins folder for your vault This is typically [vault-root]/.obsidian/pluginsAlternatively, go to the Community plugins tab in your vault's Settings and click on the folder icon to the right of the Installed plugins section Add the main.js, manifest.json, and styles.css files to the personal-os folderRestart Obsidian

searchDocs.title: Method 1 - Extract and Open Vault‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Download the Personal OS vault (link above)Extract/unzip the vault and move the extracted folder to the preferred location on your computerIn Obsidian, open the "Manage vaults" screen If you have existing vaults, click on the vault switcher and then "Manage vaults..."If you do not have existing vaults, this is the default screen when launching Obsidian Click the "Open" button next to "Open folder as vault", then browse to and select the folder containing the vault filesAt the prompt asking "Do you trust the author of this vault?" select "Trust author and enable plugins"Wait approximately 10-15 seconds, close the vault and open it again  tip When extracting the files, you may find that all of the vault files are in a folder within the folder created by the unzip utility. While this does not prevent the vault from working, you can move all of the vault contents from the nested folder up one level and delete the now empty nested folder to avoid unecessary or excess folder structure. For example, if you stored your vaults in a folder named "vaults":.../vaults/PersonOS-Vault/PersonalOS-Vault/.obsidian/...vs.../vaults/PersonOS-Vault/.obsidian/...

searchDocs.title: Method 2 - Create and Copy Vault‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Download the Personal OS vault (link above)Extract/unzip the vault and move the extracted folder to the preferred location on your computerIn Obsidian, open the "Manage vaults" screen If you have existing vaults, click on the vault switcher and then "Manage vaults..."If you do not have existing vaults, this is the default screen when launching Obsidian Click the "Create" button next to "Create new vault", naming the vault as desired and placing the vault in the desired locationIn the newly created vault, open "Settings" and go to the "Community plugins" tabClick on the button labeled "Turn on community plugins"Close the newly created vault then delete the contents of the new vault folder (not the folder itself)Copy the Personal OS vault contents and paste them into the new vault folderOpen the new vault in Obsidian

searchDocs.title: üìÅ Motivational‚Äã
searchDocs.content: ‚ÄúWhy?‚Äù ‚Äì entities that define what you move toward or away from

searchDocs.title: Aspirational‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Entities representing desired outcomes you aim to realize  Dream ‚Äì an idealized or emotionally charged visionDesire ‚Äì an emotionally felt inclination toward something you want to obtain or experienceGoal ‚Äì a specific, desired outcome Competence-Level ‚Äì a target internal capability or skill level treated as a goalMilestone ‚Äì a significant checkpoint or completion marker on the path to a goalTarget ‚Äì a predefined value or condition that must be reached  Example ‚ÄúA Dream is an Aspirational entity, and any Aspirational entity is a Motivational entity.‚Äù

searchDocs.title: Aversive‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Entities representing negative outcomes you seek to avoid  Nightmare ‚Äì a vivid, emotionally charged vision of an unwanted futureFear ‚Äì an emotionally charged anticipation of danger or failureRisk ‚Äì a specific negative potential outcome

searchDocs.title: üß© Related Concepts (Not Classes)‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Concept	DescriptionPurpose	An identity-linked directional value or commitment. Best represented as a property or note attached to an Agentive entity (e.g., a Person). Achievement	A goal that has been attained. Represented as a Goal with status: done. Consequence	A realized Risk. Not a class, but useful in retrospective/review contexts. Vision	A contextual or narrative tool, often part of a Dream or Goal. Pain	A remembered or experienced state. Tracked in journals, not modeled as a class. Emotion / Feeling	Affective states that are not directionally useful. Better represented as tags or part of journal/reflection entries.

searchDocs.title: üìÅ Operational‚Äã
searchDocs.content: ‚ÄúHow?‚Äù ‚Äì entities that structure, repeat, or execute goal-directed behavior

searchDocs.title: Strategic‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Orchestrating + Occurring ‚Äì entities that structure behavior toward a defined end  Project ‚Äì a structured initiative coordinating tasks to achieve a goalMissionPlan ‚Äì a roadmap that defines steps toward a future outcomeCourse ‚Äì a structured program of sequential learning activities with a defined endProcess ‚Äì a structured sequence of operations designed for repeatable results with known boundaries

searchDocs.title: Iterative‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Orchestrating + Recurring ‚Äì entities that coordinate ongoing cycles of structured behavior  Responsibility ‚Äì an ongoing obligation to uphold standards or manage a domainCycle ‚Äì a repeating phase-based operational structure, often tied to strategic goals

searchDocs.title: Tactical‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Executing + Occurring ‚Äì entities that represent direct, focused units of work  Task ‚Äì a discrete, actionable unit of executionCombat ‚Äì a direct, attention-intensive problem or confrontationMeeting ‚Äì a coordinated session for synchronization or decision-makingTraining ‚Äì a focused activity aimed at developing or refining skill

searchDocs.title: Repetitive‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Executing + Recurring ‚Äì entities that involve regular, direct-action loops  Routine ‚Äì a sequence of actions regularly repeated to maintain standardsExercise ‚Äì a structured action performed for development or reinforcementDrill ‚Äì a high-precision repetition used for mastery or emergency response

searchDocs.title: üß© Related Concepts (Not Classes)‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Concept	DescriptionChallenge	A test of ability, often used as a motivational wrapper around tasks or projects Sprint	A bounded execution timeframe used within projects or cycles Session	A single instance of active work or learning, often logged under Tactical or Repetitive entities Habit	A persistent behavioral pattern; tracked through Routine, Drill, or Reflection, not a distinct class Regimen	A strict set of behaviors within a health or development context; modeled as Routine or Cycle Practice	An open-ended repetition of skills; best logged under Training or Exercise Rotation	A shifting schedule of duties, best captured as a metadata property of Routine or Responsibility

searchDocs.title: üìÅ Instrumental‚Äã
searchDocs.content: ‚ÄúWith what?‚Äù ‚Äì entities that enable, guide, constrain, or shape execution

searchDocs.title: Executional‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Entities that directly enable or operationalize action  Competence ‚Äì a validated level of skill or readiness to perform Skill ‚Äì a learned ability to perform actions effectivelyTechnique ‚Äì a tactical method used during execution System ‚Äì an integrated set of tools, agent, processesTool ‚Äì a physical or digital object used to perform tasks Application ‚Äì a software product used for executing workSoftware ‚Äì a general-purpose system for executing workPlugin ‚Äì a modular enhancement for an applicationWidget ‚Äì a small, functional interface component

searchDocs.title: Instructional‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Entities that guide or structure specific actions  Method ‚Äì a prescribed way of doing somethingGuide ‚Äì a broader instructional document or pathProcedure ‚Äì a step-by-step operational protocol How-To ‚Äì a short, instructional sequence Template ‚Äì a reusable layout for consistent creation Checklist ‚Äì a list of actions to standardize executionTactic - a template for a tactical operationCourse-Template ‚Äì a blueprint for creating instructional pathsExercise-Template ‚Äì a repeatable training unit formatMission-Template ‚Äì a format for organizing purpose-driven actions

searchDocs.title: Informational‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Entities that support reasoning, synthesis, or contextual understanding  Note ‚Äì a stored personal thought, quote, or insightKnowledge ‚Äì aggregated and relevant understanding >> To add to concepts, knowledge represents "mastered" Instrumental entities.Example ‚Äì a concrete illustration of a pattern or use caseSource ‚Äì source data or structured references Book ‚Äì an extended work with useful insights or learning value Reference ‚Äì a citation or link to external informationModel ‚Äì a structured representation used in execution Design ‚Äì a deliberate arrangement or model for something Documentation ‚Äì detailed explanations of systems or proceduresDescription ‚Äì a general overview or explanation of something Mission-Description ‚Äì a narrative summary or explanation of a mission Statement ‚Äì a testable or philosophical claimConcept ‚Äì a core abstraction or category used in modelingTerm ‚Äì a specific word used within a conceptual modelProperty ‚Äì a measurable or descriptive attributeRelation ‚Äì a semantic or structural connection between concepts

searchDocs.title: Regulatory‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Entities that constrain or structure decision-making or performance  Principle ‚Äì a guiding value or heuristic / an abstract, generalizable rule or value used to guide behaviorRule ‚Äì a formal or informal behavioral constraintRequirement ‚Äì a needed condition or prerequisiteCriteria ‚Äì specific rules or checklists used to evaluate outcomesBenchmark ‚Äì reference value or best-practice target used for comparisonStandard ‚Äì a defined expectation or norm for performance or design

searchDocs.title: Behavioral‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Entities that shape mindset, perception, or motivation during action  Belief ‚Äì a personal assumption or value that influences behaviorMindset ‚Äì an overarching attitude that colors decision-makingTrigger ‚Äì a stimulus or condition that activates a behaviorQuote ‚Äì an inspirational or clarifying statementPrayer ‚Äì a ritualized or reflective phrase used before actionTip ‚Äì a short practical piece of adviceHelper ‚Äì a message, label, or UI tip that assists executionSetting ‚Äì a stored or changeable configuration that affects environment

searchDocs.title: üìÅ Evaluative‚Äã
searchDocs.content: ‚ÄúHow well?‚Äù ‚Äì entities that represent the result of an assessment, reflection, or comparative judgment

searchDocs.title: Indicator‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Entities that represent tracked or measured values reflecting current or past performance  Metric ‚Äì a numeric value tracked over time (e.g. daily steps, hours slept)KPI ‚Äì a high-level performance metric tied to a strategic objectiveTarget ‚Äì a predefined numeric or qualitative threshold to be reachedScore ‚Äì a discrete rating of success or performance (e.g. 4/5 stars, A+)

searchDocs.title: Reflection‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Entities that represent personal or subjective insight derived from observation or journaling  Journal ‚Äì a narrative log used to observe patterns, behavior, or mindsetInsight ‚Äì a realization or lesson drawn from experience or analysisFeedback ‚Äì a reaction from others or from self in response to behavior or outcomes

searchDocs.title: Judgment‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Entities that express structured evaluations based on criteria or comparisons  Evaluation ‚Äì a structured result comparing observed outcomes to expectationsScorecard ‚Äì a summary table comparing results across several key dimensionsLeaderboard ‚Äì a ranked list comparing performance across agents or entitiesReview ‚Äì a periodic or event-based summary of performance, progress, or quality

searchDocs.title: üìÅ Agentive‚Äã
searchDocs.content: ‚ÄúWho?‚Äù ‚Äì entities that initiate, perform, or are responsible for actions and outcomes  Person ‚Äì an individual actor with goals, responsibilities, and behaviorsTeam ‚Äì a small group of people collaborating on shared tasks or missionsOrganization ‚Äì a broader collective structure such as a business, institution, or community

searchDocs.title: üìÅ Contextual‚Äã
searchDocs.content: ‚ÄúUnder what conditions?‚Äù ‚Äì entities that define scope, framing, setting, or timing for actions and evaluations

searchDocs.title: Temporal‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Entities that define when something occurs, progresses, or is relevant  Date ‚Äì a specific day used to group or frame entries, logs, or actions (e.g. 2025-04-24)Period ‚Äì a named or structured time range for organizing effort (e.g. Q2 2025, Launch Phase)Stage ‚Äì a bounded phase in a project or process (e.g. Stage 1: Planning, Stage 2: Execution)Arc ‚Äì a higher-level transformation or narrative track across multiple activities (e.g. Career Shift, Launch OS)

searchDocs.title: Topical‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Entities that define domain, subject, or thematic category  Area ‚Äì a domain or sphere of responsibility, work, or life (e.g. Health, Business, Relationships)Domain ‚Äì a knowledge field or discipline that informs action (e.g. Design, Psychology)Category ‚Äì a thematic or structural grouping used to classify entities (e.g. Tool Types, Content Formats)

searchDocs.title: Situational‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Entities that define physical, digital, or role-based framing for actions  Environment ‚Äì a physical, social, or digital setting that shapes execution (e.g. Remote, On-site, Test Server)Role ‚Äì a situational identity or function assigned to an agent within a specific context (e.g. CEO, Coach, Reviewer)

searchDocs.title: Obsidian Functions‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Hotkey	Description	Commandctrl + P	Control - Palette	Command palette: Open command palette ctrl + N	Control - New	Create new note ctrl + O	Control - Open	Quick switcher - Open quick switcher ctrl + W	Control - Work tab	Close current tab alt + M	Alternative - Move	Move current file to another folder alt + !	Alternative - Pin!	Toggle pin ctrl + E	Control - Edit	Toggle reading view alt + P	Alternative - Property	Add file property alt + L	Alternative - List	Toggle bullet list ctrl + T	Control - New Tab	New tab ctrl + 1	Control - Tab 1	Go to tab 1 ctrl + 2	Control - Tab 1	Go to tab 2 ctrl + 3	Control - Tab 1	Go to tab 3 ctrl + 4	Control - Tab 1	Go to tab 4 ctrl + 5	Control - Tab 1	Go to tab 5 ctrl + 6	Control - Tab 1	Go to tab 6 ctrl + 7	Control - Tab 1	Go to tab 7 ctrl + 8	Control - Tab 1	Go to tab 8 ctrl + 9	Control - Tab n	Go to last tab ctrl + tab	Control - Tab	Go to next tab ctrl + shift + tab	Control - Super Tab	Go to previous tab ctrl + page up	Control - Page Up	Go to next tab ctrl + page down	Control - Page Down	Go to previous tab ctrl + alt + ‚Üê	Control - Alternative Back	Navigate back ctrl + alt + ‚Üí	Control - Alternative Forward	Navigate forward alt + enter	Alternative - Enter	Follow link under cursor ctrl + enter	Control - Enter	Open link under cursor in new tab ctrl + alt + enter	Control - Alternative Enter	Open link under cursor to the right /	Slash command	Inline trigger for command palette ctrl + shift + I	Control - Super Investigate	Open developer console

searchDocs.title: Personal OS Functions‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Hotkey	Description	Commandalt + 1	Alternative first workflow	Personal OS: Engage alt + 2	Alternative second workflow	Personal OS: Process alt + 3	Alternative third workflow	Personal OS: Engage Current File alt + D	Alternative - Delay	Personal OS: Generate delayed date alt + shift + D	Alternative - Super Delay	Personal OS: Delay file dates ctrl + R	Control - Read Actions	Personal OS: Toggle actions hider alt + A	Alternative - Action time	Personal OS: Insert time emoji

searchDocs.title: Community Plugin Functions‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Hotkey	Description	Commandctrl + L	Control - List	Tasks: Toggle task done ctrl + shift + ‚Üë	Control - Super Up	Outliner: Move list and sublists up ctrl + shift + ‚Üì	Control - Super Down	Outliner: Move list and sublists down atl + N	Alternative - New	Templater: Create new note from template alt + T	Alternative - Template	Templater: Open insert template modal
